top_comments_top.body:
As a reminder, this subreddit [is for civil discussion.](/r/politics/wiki/index#wiki_be_civil)

In general, be courteous to others. Debate/discuss/argue the merits of ideas, don't attack people. Personal insults, shill or troll accusations, hate speech, any suggestion or support of harm, violence, or death, and other rule violations can result in a permanent ban. 

If you see comments in violation of our rules, please report them.

 For those who have questions regarding any media outlets being posted on this subreddit, please click [here](https://www.reddit.com/r/politics/wiki/approveddomainslist) to review our details as to our approved domains list and outlet criteria.

***


*I am a bot, and this action was performed automatically. Please [contact the moderators of this subreddit](/message/compose/?to=/r/politics) if you have any questions or concerns.*
This race is very close according to polling. Yet there could be a polling error but that works both ways. If you are considering not voting, I think that would be a mistake

Democrats should be panicking seeing the polls and the early voting numbers! 

In a state that was supposedly blue, where Biden won by +10 and democrats control both chambers it shouldn't be this close 

The problem is that democrats are obsessed with and fixated on three things: 

Trump

The insurrection 

Taylor-Greene 

While the average american doesn't even think about those things anymore and isn't politics-obsessed democrats have nothing to offer that fear of things americans don't care anymore 

But when americans go to the super market and see those prices soaring week by week (historic highs inflation) those empty shelves and can't finds things the buy (supply chain) with gas over $5 and a party at war internally incapable of deliver and do things, a party that has paralyzed Washington because they can't agree on a simple piece of legislation and a president living in 90s America  that is when voters make decisions
Leaving to vote now. Fuck you Glenn Youngkin (a perfect GOP name if I might add)
